extension.valueMarkdown: Reviewing a Triage Deferral (Triage Scenario Three)
This is linked to the reivewing a Task [PUT /Task](#/Task/put_Task).

resource.documentation: Supports Referrals and advice guidance requests (new)

extension.valueMarkdown: Initial Advice Creation (A+G Scenario One)

code should be a child concept of Evaluation procedure code (SNOMED CT 386053000)?. The advice and guidance referral is created along with a corresponding worklist (FHIR Task) item. These are retrieved via the [GET /Task](#/Task/get_Task) API and responses are sent via the [PUT /Task](#/Task/put_Task) API.
Create Referral (A+G Scenario Five)

code should be a child concept of Patient Referral procedure code (SNOMED CT 3457005)? 

 Following from the advice and guidnace workflow completing, it has been decided to refer the patient to a service. Note the use of basedOn to reference the original advice and guidance request.
Initial Referral Creation (Triage Scenario One)
Note: the status is set to `draft` until this referral is triaged this can not be acted upon. To create the actual defferal see [POST /Task](#/Task/post_Task)
Referral found
Request **GET [baseUrl]/ServiceRequest?patient.identifier=https://fhir.nhs.uk/Id/nhs-number|9912003888**

searchParam.name: patient:identifier
searchParam.documentation: The patient identifier (e.g. NHS Number) that the service request is about

extension.valueMarkdown: Responding to Advice (A+G Scenario Two)

A user (sds-user-id=0987654321) responds to the worklist item. A document can be attached to the ServiceRequest and Task by using the [POST /Binary](#/Binary/post_Binary) POST / and [POST /DocumentReference](#/DocumentReference/post_DocumentReference) endpoints.
Requesting additional advice, increasing priority (A+G Scenario Three)
The Task.priority is increased to urgent. The use of PATCH /Task can also be considered as an alternative for this interaction.
Provider converts advice request (A+G Scenario Four and Six)
The Task.status is completed. See [POST /ServiceRequest](#/ServiceRequest/post_ServiceRequest) for the new referral (scenario Five)
Reviewing a Triage Deferral (Triage Scenario Three)
Task.status set to completed. Review advice linked in Task.output. Next actions to mark as to book or create an Appointment [POST /Appointment](#/Appointment/post_Appointment)
Deferral Creation (Triage Scenario Two)
Task.code not set, need advice on code. [PUT /Task](#/Task/put_Task) is used to reply to the deferral.
A+G Guidance Conversation
Search on workflow history for a specific referral
A+G Guidance Conversation
Search on a Id of a worklist/A+G workflow item
Worklist found
Request **GET [baseUrl]/Task?for.identifier=https://fhir.nhs.uk/Id/nhs-number|9912003888**

searchParam.name: appointment-type
searchParam.documentation: The style of appointment or patient that may be booked in the slot (not service type)

searchParam.name: schedule.actor:HealthcareService
searchParam.documentation: A single service ID is required to indicate the service for which appointment slots are required.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The free/busy status of the appointment

interaction.documentation: Use this api to create a shortlist
Use this api to retrieve a shortlist
Unable to find existing matching service

searchParam.name: service-type
searchParam.documentation: The type of service provided by this healthcare service

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Can't find this parameter presume need to: External identifiers for this item

resource.documentation: Used to index supporting information documents - documents themselves use Binary

extension.valueMarkdown: Responding to Advice (A+G Scenario Two)
Once the Task has been updated [PUT /Task](#/Task/put_Task), a DocumentReference is used to link in a previsouly posted document to the ServiceRequest and/or Task
